subject: Re: [junit] Shared data between test methods in a testcase
msgSnippet: there is one way to do a one time setup and tearDown in a test class,here is how: public class TestOne extends TestCase { public static void oneTimeSetUp() {
messageBody:
there is one way to do a one time setup and tearDown in a test class,here is how:

public class TestOne extends TestCase

{

 public static void oneTimeSetUp()
    {
        System.out.println("test set up ");
    }

public static void oneTimeTearDown()
    {
        System.out.println("test tear down ");
    }

    public void test1()
    {
        System.out.println("test1");
    }

    public void test2()
    {
        System.out.println("test2");
    }
    public static Test suite()
    {
        TestSuite suite= new TestSuite(TestOne.class);

        TestSetup wrapper= new TestSetup(suite)
        {
            public void setUp()
            {
                oneTimeSetUp();
            }
            public void tearDown()
            {
                oneTimeTearDown()

            }
        };
        return wrapper;

     }

run this class you can see setup is done in the first order,and teardown is the last one.

and if you specify the order to exe the test case,you can share data as you want.

Ellen
